arts.ttl: Belarus v Scotland: World Cup 2026 qualifying Group C – live
arts.sum: Updates from this 7.45pm BST kick-off in Group C Email Michael | Sign up to Football Daily Perhaps a little surprising to see Clarke make FOUR changes from the side that drew with Denmark. The introduction of Gannon-Doak and Gilmour was expected given that Scotland will have more of the ball and look to be more enterprising against Belarus, but changing McKenna for Hanley at centre back and Johnston for Hickey at right back is something of a surprise. Belarus: Lapoukhov, Karpovich, Parkhomenko, Volkov, Zabelin, Pechenin, Myakish, Kalinin, Ebong, Malashevich, Barkovsky. Subs: Ignatovich, Pavlyuchenko, Martynovich, Demchenko, Gromyko, Yablonskiy, Korzun, Malkevich, Kovalev, Pasevich, Pigas, Melnichenko. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Belarus vs Scotland – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Scotland face Belarus in World Cup qualification on Monday evening, aiming to build on a solid start. Steve Clarke’s side held Denmark to a goalless draw in their opener, ahead of facing a Belarus team who were hammered 5-1 by Greece. arts.sum: Scotland prepare for their crucial World Cup qualifier against Belarus at the ZTE Arena on Monday evening. arts.ttl: Why will Scotland be playing Belarus in Hungary?
arts.sum: Scotland's World Cup qualifier against Belarus on 8 September will take place at a neutral venue, but the Tartan Army will not be there to see it.
